Legal_Issue: Whether a courtesy letter constitutes a decision subject to judicial review
Evidence_Assessment: Letter from Assistant Commissioner dated November 5, 2003
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to show decision is reviewable
Legal_Rule: Only formal decisions or orders are subject to judicial review under the Federal Court Act
Standard_of_Review: Statutory interpretation of 'decision' under the Federal Court Act
Grounds_for_Claim: Challenge to administrative inaction and finality of staffing decision
Outcome_on_Merits: Not reached – application dismissed on jurisdictional grounds
Legal_Framework: Federal public service staffing rules and judicial review principles
Applicant_Challenge: Seeking review of letter confirming no further recourse available
Defendant_Response: Letter is not a decision under the Act
Outcome: Application dismissed for lack of jurisdiction
Remedy_Sought: Review and potential intervention in staffing matter
Legal_Provision: Federal Court Act, sections related to reviewable decisions
Outcome_of_Review: No review conducted – outside court’s jurisdiction
Governing_Rule: Only formal decisions are reviewable under the Federal Court Act
